body_html:
Unfortunately I am currently unable to get my android device mounted on my computer, and I've tried asking on StackOverflow in this link some time ago: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/43996994/android-unable-to-mount-android-phone-although-lsusb-shows-device-and-after-ins

I am currently building the APK before transferring it onto dropbox to let my android phone download the app as a workaround.

As the labels and pb file names needs to be changed in this file as well, before building the APK. To keep things simple, I simply renamed the pb file name and the labels file name to be the same as what the demo app provided, and the frozen graph APK works fine. Once again, when I tried quantizing the graph, my app crashes. Is there a way to get the error log files without using ADB?

body:
Unfortunately I am currently unable to get my android device mounted on my computer, and I've tried asking on StackOverflow in this link some time ago: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/43996994/android-unable-to-mount-android-phone-although-lsusb-shows-device-and-after-ins

I am currently building the APK before transferring it onto dropbox to let my android phone download the app as a workaround.

As the labels and pb file names needs to be changed in this file as well, before building the APK. To keep things simple, I simply renamed the pb file name and the labels file name to be the same as what the demo app provided, and the frozen graph APK works fine. Once again, when I tried quantizing the graph, my app crashes. Is there a way to get the error log files without using ADB?
